item.title: Struggling with complexity
item.description: One of the things I constantly struggle with is managing complexity in writing. Write too complex a piece, and it’ll sit there unread and unused. But stripping away complexity also strips away meaning, and risks context collapse (which I want to deal with soon). Stanford University’s Prof. Robert Sapolsky seems to manage this balance between complexity and accessibility in his course "BIO150, Introduction to Human Behavioural Biology", available on YouTube.
